title: Employees Earning More Than Managers
markdown:
# **Employees Earning More Than Managers**

## Given a table Employee with employee and manager info, find employees who earn more than their managers.

### Table Schema
| Column    | Type    |
|-----------|---------|
| id        | INT     |
| name      | TEXT    |
| salary    | INT     |
| managerId | INT     |

### Example

**Input:**
```
**Employee**
+----+-------+--------+-----------+
| id | name  | salary | managerId |
+----+-------+--------+-----------+
| 1  | Joe   | 70000  | 3         |
| 2  | Henry | 80000  | 4         |
| 3  | Sam   | 60000  | None      |
| 4  | Max   | 90000  | None      |
+----+-------+--------+-----------+
```

**Expected Output:**
```
+----------+
| Employee |
+----------+
| Joe      |
+----------+
```

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE Employee(id INT, name TEXT, salary INT, managerId INT); INSERT INTO Employee VALUES (1,'Joe',70000,3),(2,'Henry',80000,4),(3,'Sam',60000,NULL),(4,'Max',90000,NULL);
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT e.name AS Employee FROM Employee e JOIN Employee m ON e.managerId = m.id WHERE e.salary > m.salary;

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE Employee(id INT, name TEXT, salary INT, managerId INT); INSERT INTO Employee VALUES (1,'Joe',50000,2),(2,'Sam',60000,NULL);
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT e.name AS Employee FROM Employee e JOIN Employee m ON e.managerId = m.id WHERE e.salary > m.salary;

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE Employee(id INT, name TEXT, salary INT, managerId INT); INSERT INTO Employee VALUES (1,'A',70000,3),(2,'B',80000,3),(3,'C',50000,NULL);
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT e.name AS Employee FROM Employee e JOIN Employee m ON e.managerId = m.id WHERE e.salary > m.salary;

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE Employee(id INT, name TEXT, salary INT, managerId INT);
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT e.name AS Employee FROM Employee e JOIN Employee m ON e.managerId = m.id WHERE e.salary > m.salary;
